meanings.definition: To place, hold, or move the toes in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: She was toeing the line carefully to avoid tripping.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys toeing the ball into the goal during soccer practice.
meanings.sent3: The cat was toeing the edge of the table, trying to catch a glimpse of the food.
meanings.sent4: The dancer was toeing the line between grace and precision in her performance.
meanings.sent5: The toddler was toeing the line between walking and running, taking small steps forward.

meanings.definition: To conform to a particular standard or line of behavior.
meanings.sent1: The students were toeing the school rules to avoid getting in trouble.
meanings.sent2: She was toeing the company's dress code by wearing a suit to the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The dog was toeing the line by sitting quietly during obedience training.
meanings.sent4: He was toeing the line of politeness by not interrupting others while they spoke.
meanings.sent5: The team was toeing the line of sportsmanship by congratulating their opponents after the game.

meanings.definition: To follow closely or adhere to a particular course of action.
meanings.sent1: The detective was toeing the suspect to gather more evidence.
meanings.sent2: She was toeing the instructions carefully to assemble the furniture correctly.
meanings.sent3: The child was toeing the bedtime routine by brushing teeth and putting on pajamas.
meanings.sent4: He was toeing the path of honesty by admitting his mistake to his friend.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was toeing the trail markers to avoid getting lost in the forest.
